home.title: Welcome to NUI
home.subtitle: A modern and customizable Angular component library
home.description: Build beautiful applications with our complete set of UI components

installation.title: Installation
installation.subtitle: Get started with NUI in your Angular project
installation.step1Description: Use npm or yarn to install the NUI package in your project.
installation.step2Description: Configure NUI in your application configuration file. Define the preset you want to use and the theme mode.
installation.step3Description: You can import NUI styles in three different ways: in your global styles.scss file, in angular.json, or in project.json if you're using Nx.
installation.step4Description: You can now use any NUI component in your HTML templates.

configuration.title: Configuration
configuration.subtitle: Configure NUI according to your needs
configuration.presetConfigDescription: Presets define your application's color palette. NUI includes 8 predefined presets: aura, warm, neon, dopamine, corporate, minimal, sunset and ocean.
configuration.darkModeConfigDescription: Control how dark mode is applied in your application. Available options are: 'manual' (controlled by code), 'auto' (based on time of day), or 'system' (according to operating system preferences).
configuration.customPresetConfigDescription: Create your own preset by defining custom colors for light and dark modes. Each preset must include: primary, secondary, accent, success, info, warning, danger and neutral.

theming.title: Themes and presets
theming.subtitle: Customize your application's appearance
theming.description: NUI includes multiple predefined presets. Each preset defines a unique color palette that applies to all components.
theming.selectPreset: Select a preset to preview it

presetDescriptions.aura: Modern and elegant default palette with teal and purple tones
presetDescriptions.warm: Energetic palette with warm coral and golden tones, perfect for e-commerce
presetDescriptions.neon: Futuristic cyberpunk palette with electric cyan and neon colors, ideal for gaming
presetDescriptions.dopamine: Optimistic and cheerful palette with bright lime and pink tones
presetDescriptions.corporate: Professional blue palette, perfect for enterprise applications
presetDescriptions.minimal: Refined minimalist palette with subtle colors and elegant purple accent
presetDescriptions.sunset: Warm and vibrant palette with pink, orange and coral tones, perfect for creative apps
presetDescriptions.ocean: Calm and professional palette with deep blues and aqua tones, ideal for productivity

overview.title: Theming System Overview
overview.subtitle: A powerful, runtime-configurable theming solution for Angular applications

whatItSolves.title: What Problem Does It Solve?
whatItSolves.description: NUI's theming system eliminates the need for manual CSS configuration, theme rebuilds, or complex SCSS variable management. It provides a unified, type-safe way to customize your application's appearance at runtime.

runtimeSwitching.title: Runtime Theme Switching
runtimeSwitching.description: Change themes instantly without page reload or rebuild. Perfect for user preferences and A/B testing.

darkMode.title: Automatic Dark Mode
darkMode.description: Built-in dark mode support with automatic color adjustments and multiple activation strategies.

tokenGeneration.title: 200+ CSS Variables
tokenGeneration.description: Comprehensive variable system covering colors, shades, tints, alpha values, and component-specific tokens.

componentSpecific.title: Component-Specific Variables
componentSpecific.description: Each component has its own customizable CSS variables that inherit from the global theme.

typeSafety.title: Type-Safe Configuration
typeSafety.description: Full TypeScript support with interfaces that ensure your custom themes are correctly configured.

zeroScss.title: Zero Build Overhead
zeroScss.description: Themes are generated in browser at runtime. No need to rebuild your application when changing themes.

integration.title: How It Integrates
integration.description: The theming system is deeply integrated into NUI and works seamlessly across all components:
integration.point1: Single Configuration Point: Define your theme once in provideNUIConfig()
integration.point2: Automatic Propagation: All NUI components automatically consume theme variables
integration.point3: Custom Components: Your own components can use NUI CSS variables for consistent styling
integration.point4: Runtime Control: Switch themes or toggle dark mode programmatically via ThemeService
integration.point5: Framework Agnostic CSS: Variables work in any HTML/CSS, not just Angular components

keyFeatures.title: Key Technical Features
keyFeatures.feat1: CSS variables dynamically generated from TypeScript configuration
keyFeatures.feat2: (primary, secondary, accent, success, info, warning, danger, neutral)
keyFeatures.feat3: for consistent neutrals across light and dark modes
keyFeatures.feat4: (shades, tints, alpha values) generated for each color
keyFeatures.feat5: with manual, system, and time-based strategies

architecture.title: Theme Architecture
architecture.subtitle: Deep dive into how NUI generates and structures CSS variables

semantic.title: Semantic Color System
semantic.description: NUI uses 8 semantic colors that convey meaning and intent. Each color generates multiple CSS variables for different use cases.
semantic.primary: Main brand color, used for primary actions and key UI elements
semantic.secondary: Supporting color for secondary actions and complementary elements
semantic.accent: Highlight color for emphasis, links, and interactive elements
semantic.success: Positive feedback, confirmations, and successful operations
semantic.info: Informational messages, neutral notifications, and helper text
semantic.warning: Cautions, alerts that require attention but aren't critical
semantic.danger: Errors, destructive actions, and critical alerts
semantic.neutral: Backgrounds, borders, disabled states, and neutral UI elements

variants.title: Automatic Variant Generation
variants.description: For each semantic color, NUI automatically generates variants to ensure visual hierarchy and accessibility:

tints.title: Tints
tints.description: Lighter versions of the base color, ideal for backgrounds and hover states.

shades.title: Shades
shades.description: Darker versions of the base color, perfect for active states and emphasis.

alpha.title: Alpha Variants
alpha.description: Transparent versions of the base color for overlays, borders, and subtle effects.

structural.title: Structural Variables
structural.description: Beyond colors, NUI provides structural variables that define the visual foundation of your application:

components.title: Component-Specific Variables
components.description: Each NUI component can define its own CSS variables that inherit from the theme system but allow fine-grained customization.
components.button: Button variables control padding, heights, shadows, and state colors
components.avatar: Avatar variables define sizes, background colors and text colors for different states
components.toast: Toast variables define icon sizes, spacing, and type-specific colors

naming.title: Naming Convention
naming.description: All CSS variables follow a predictable naming pattern:
naming.pattern:
--nui-[category]-[name]-[variant]

Examples:
--nui-color-primary          // Base primary color
--nui-color-primary-shade-50 // Darker primary
--nui-color-primary-tint-100 // Lighter primary
--nui-color-primary-alpha-20 // 20% transparent primary
--nui-bg-primary             // Primary background
--nui-text-primary           // Primary text color

darkMode.title: Dark Mode Strategies
darkMode.subtitle: Multiple ways to handle dark mode in your application
darkMode.strategiesDescription: NUI provides three different strategies for managing dark mode, each suited for different use cases:

manual.title: Manual
manual.description: Full programmatic control. Dark mode is toggled explicitly via ThemeService.
manual.feat1: Complete control in your application code
manual.feat3: Perfect for apps with theme switcher UI

system.title: System
system.description: Automatically follows the user's operating system preference using prefers-color-scheme media query.
system.feat2: Updates automatically when user changes OS preference

auto.title: Auto
auto.description: Intelligent time-based switching. Dark mode activates during evening hours (8 PM - 6 AM local time).
auto.feat1: Activates dark mode from 8 PM to 6 AM
auto.feat2: Reduces eye strain during night usage

demo.title: Try It Out
demo.description: The showcase is configured with 'manual' strategy, you can control dark mode programmatically:

customClass.description: By default, NUI adds the 'dark-mode' class to <html> when dark mode is active. You can customize this class name:

cssVars.subtitle: Browse and search all 200+ CSS variables generated by the theme system
cssVars.noResults: No variables found matching your search

usage.description: You can use any NUI CSS variable in your components' stylesheets:

customization.title: Creating Custom Themes
customization.subtitle: Build your own theme presets with custom colors

intro.title: Why Create Custom Themes?
intro.description: Custom themes allow you to match your brand identity, create unique user experiences, or offer multiple theme options to your users. NUI makes it easy with a type-safe configuration system.

customization.stepsTitle: Steps to Create a Custom Theme

step1.title: Define Your Theme Preset
step1.description: Create a ThemePreset object with colors for both light and dark modes. Each mode requires 8 semantic colors.

step2.title: Register Your Theme
step2.description: Add your custom preset to the NUI configuration in your app.config.ts or main.ts:

step3.title: Use Your Theme
step3.description: Your custom theme is now active! You can also switch between themes at runtime:

grayScale.title: Custom Gray Scale (Optional)
grayScale.description: You can also define a custom 10-step gray scale for even more control over neutral colors. If omitted, NUI generates one automatically.

bestPractices.title: Best Practices
bestPractices.practice1: Use hex colors for best compatibility and performance
bestPractices.practice2: Test in both light and dark modes to ensure readability and contrast
bestPractices.practice3: Keep semantic meaning consistent (e.g., danger should always mean error/destructive)
bestPractices.practice4: Use color contrast checkers to meet WCAG accessibility standards
bestPractices.practice5: Consider color blindness - don't rely solely on color to convey information

tip1.title: Multiple Custom Presets
tip1.description: You can register multiple custom presets and let users choose between them at runtime.

tip2.title: Preset Inheritance
tip2.description: Start from an existing preset and override only specific colors to create variations.

tip3.title: Dynamic Theme Generation
tip3.description: Generate themes programmatically based on user input, brand colors, or API data.

button.title: Button
button.subtitle: Versatile button component with multiple variants, sizes and states

basic.title: Basic button
basic.description: The simplest form of a button with default styles.

variants-colors.title: Variants and colors
variants-colors.description: Supports different variants (Solid, Outline, Ghost) and NUI system colors.
variants-colors.note: Combine color and variant to customize the button's appearance according to your needs.

sizes.title: Sizes
sizes.description: Five size options available in NUI.
sizes.note: Sizes affect the button's height, horizontal padding and font size. Use size with values 'xs', 'sm', 'md', 'lg' and 'xl'.

icons.title: Icons
icons.description: Add icons to buttons at the start or end. Buttons with only an icon are rendered as circular icon buttons.
icons.note: Icon position: 'start' shows the icon before the text, 'end' shows it after. Icon-only buttons require the aria-label attribute for accessibility.

loading.title: Loading state
loading.description: Shows a loading spinner in three positions: start, end or center (which replaces the content).
loading.note: Loading positions: 'start' shows the spinner before the text, 'end' shows it after, 'center' completely replaces the content with a centered spinner. If the button only contains an icon the content is also replaced by the spinner while loading.

width.title: Width
width.description: Control the button's width: auto (default), full (100%) or fit (adjusted to content).
width.note: Width options: 'auto' adapts to content with standard padding, 'full' stretches to 100% of the container, 'fit' uses the minimum necessary space.

disabled.title: Disabled state
disabled.description: Disabled buttons prevent user interaction and show a dimmed appearance.

events.title: Events
events.description: Handle click events with the onClick output. Supports button types: button, submit and reset.
events.consoleNote: Open the DevTools (F12) and check the Console tab to see the logged events when you click the buttons.

directive.title: Using directive
directive.description: Apply button styles to native HTML elements using the nuiButton directive.
directive.note: You can use the nuiButton directive on any native HTML element like <button>, <a> or <div> to apply NUI button styles and behaviors.

api.title: API and reference
api.description: Complete documentation of Button component inputs and outputs for integration in your projects.

styling.title: Styling and customization
styling.description: Customize the button's appearance using CSS variables. Control sizes, typography, colors and more.

actionMenu.title: Action Menu
actionMenu.subtitle: Dropdown menu component with support for static, dynamic items and submenus

basic.title: Basic usage
basic.description: Simple action menu with item array. Each item can have a label, icon and action.
basic.note: Here we see an example of using both type='static' and type='dynamic'.
basic.consoleNote: Open DevTools (F12) and check the Console tab to see the logged actions when you click the menu items.

separators.title: Separators
separators.description: Group related actions using visual separators.
separators.note: Use items with the separator: true property to add dividing lines between action groups. You can add an optional label to the separator using the label property.

submenu.title: Submenus
submenu.description: Create nested menus using the children property. Submenus can be nested multiple levels.
submenu.note: Use the children property to define submenu items. Each child can have its own children for further nesting. Note: If a child has selected: true, the parent item will show a visual indicator (vertical line on the left) to facilitate navigation.

variants.title: Button variants
variants.description: The button supports different variants and NUI system colors. The variant will affect the button, but the color affects the color and the content.
variants.note: Combine color and variant to customize the menu button's appearance according to your needs.

sizes.title: Sizes
sizes.description: Make use of the five predefined NUI sizes. The size affects the button, but the content will remain the same.
sizes.note: Use the size input to adjust the menu button size and its content using sizes xs, sm, md, lg and xl.

label.title: Button content
label.description: Add text to the menu button. Can be combined with icons and supports full width mode.
label.note: Use icon along with label to display both on the button. Use width='full' to make the button occupy the full available width. If you only use label without icon, the button renders as a simple text button.

disabled.title: Disabled state
disabled.description: Disable individual menu items or the entire menu. Disabled items are shown but not clickable.

withSubtitle.title: Item subtitle
withSubtitle.description: Add secondary text below the main label. Useful for displaying additional information like emails, descriptions or shortcuts.

selected.title: Selected state
selected.description: Mark items as selected to show the current choice. A check icon appears automatically. Perfect for selectors, filters or settings.

icons.title: Descriptive icons
icons.description: Use meaningful icons and labels to communicate the purpose of each action. Icons help users quickly identify actions.
icons.note: Use relevant icons from the Remix Icon library to improve the visual understanding of menu actions.

template.title: Custom template
template.description: Fully customize the menu rendering using templates and directives.
template.note:
The #item template receives the complete item as context (let-item). The menu-header and menu-footer directives allow simple and clear syntax, avoiding unnecessary ng-template.

Important: When using custom templates, you must handle the click event manually with (click)="handleAction(item)". The onItemAction event is only emitted automatically with default items.

api.title: API and reference
api.description: Complete documentation of inputs, outputs and the ActionMenuItem interface for integrating the component in your projects.

styling.title: Styling and customization
styling.description: Customize the menu's appearance using CSS variables. Control colors, spacing, typography and more.

avatar.title: Avatar
avatar.subtitle: Graphic component to represent users, entities or brands using images, letters or icons

basic.title: Basic usage
basic.description: Shows a simple avatar loading an external image. This is the most common way of user representation.

types.title: Content types and priority
types.description: The component intelligently decides what to show based on available data. This logic ensures something meaningful is always shown.
types.note: Rendering priority: 1. Image (if loads) > 2. Initials > 3. Icon > 4. Fallback (Alt Letter) > 5. Default icon.

variants.title: Shape variants
variants.description: The avatar supports three geometric shapes to adapt to different design contexts.
variants.note: Use the variant input with values 'circular', 'rounded' and 'square' to change the avatar's shape.

sizes.title: Sizes
sizes.description: Five predefined sizes that harmoniously scale the container, typography and icons.
sizes.note: Sizes affect the avatar's dimension, font size for initials and icon size. Use size with values 'xs', 'sm', 'md', 'lg' and 'xl'.

colors.title: Colors
colors.description: Customize the background and text color using the system palette. Ideal for differentiating users or states when there's no image.
colors.note: Use the color input with values like 'primary', 'secondary', 'accent', 'success', 'info', 'warning' and 'danger' to change the avatar's colors. You can also use custom colors in rgb, hexadecimal or keyword format for total control over the avatar's appearance. If you use a custom color, the component will automatically calculate a contrasting text color to ensure the legibility of initials or the icon.

customSize.title: Custom size
customSize.description: Define exact dimensions in pixels when standard sizes don't fit. Font size and icons are calculated proportionally automatically.
customSize.note: The customSize input overrides the size input. The internal calculation maintains the legibility of initials.

grouped.title: Grouped avatars
grouped.description: Display multiple avatars in a single component with overlapping and display limit.
grouped.note: Use the nui-avatar-group component to group multiple avatars. Control the maximum visible number with max. Additional avatars are rendered as a '+X' counter. You can use bordered to see a clear separation between each avatar.

error.title: Error handling (Fallback)
error.description: Automatic recovery system. If the image URL fails (404 error), the component instantly switches to showing initials or the fallback icon without breaking the design.

api.title: API and reference
api.description: Complete documentation of Avatar component inputs and outputs for integration in your projects.

styling.title: Styling and customization
styling.description: Customize the avatar's appearance using CSS variables. Control sizes, colors, borders and more.

buttonGroup.title: Button Group
buttonGroup.subtitle: Set of grouped buttons for single (Radio) or multiple (Checkbox) selection

basic.title: Basic usage
basic.description: The simplest case accepts a string array. By default, it acts as a single option selector (Radio).

modes.title: Selection modes
modes.description: Allows changing the button selection type between radiobutton and checkbox
modes.note: Change to mode='checkbox' to allow selecting multiple options at once. The returned value will be an Array.

complex.title: Complex objects
complex.description: Supports arrays of objects with custom properties for label, value and disabled state.
complex.note: Map arbitrary object properties using labelBy, valueBy, iconBy and disabledBy.

icons.title: Icons
icons.description: Supports icon-only buttons for a compact toolbar-like button bar.
icons.note: Support for Remix Icon icons. Use iconOnly='true' for a compact toolbar-like button bar. If it's an object, you can map the icon property using iconBy.

colors.title: Colors and variants
colors.description: Compatible with the entire NUI variant system (Solid, Outline, Ghost) and colors.

segmented.title: Segmented variant
segmented.description: Visual style like iOS Segmented Control, special and added to the basic NUI variant types. Ideal for view switchers (e.g.: Month / Year, List / Map).
segmented.note: Use variant='segmented' to apply this unique variant.

sizes.title: Sizes
sizes.description: Five predefined sizes that harmoniously scale the container, typography and icons.

width.title: Full width
width.description: Expands the buttons to occupy all available space equally.
width.note: Use width='full' to make each button expand and occupy equal width within the container.

api.title: API and reference
api.description: Complete documentation of inputs, outputs and advanced usage of the Button Group component.

styling.title: Styling and customization
styling.description: Customize the button group's appearance using CSS variables. Control spacing, colors, shadows and more.

paginator.title: Paginator
paginator.subtitle: Advanced component for data navigation with support for flexible layouts and infinite loading

basic.title: Basic usage
basic.description: Standard configuration with numeric navigation. Supports two-way binding of page and size.

colors.title: Colors and variants
colors.description: Supports all NUI colors and variants (Solid, Outline, Ghost).
colors.note: Combine color and variant to customize the paginator's appearance according to your needs.

sizes.title: Page size options
sizes.description: Define a custom set of options for page size.
sizes.note: Using the size input you can offer users a specific set of page sizes to choose from.

layout.title: Custom layout
layout.description: The most powerful feature. Define exactly where each element goes (top, left, center, right, bottom) using a configuration object.
layout.note: Area system: You can move the size selector to the left, put the item summary on top, or create any composition your design needs. When a layout is set, attributes like showPageSizeSelector, showFirstLast, showItemRange and showPageJump are ignored because the custom layout has full control over what to show and where.

infinite.title: Infinite loading
infinite.description: Transforms the paginator into a Load more button with integrated loading state. Ideal for mobile lists or feeds.
infinite.note: Activate infinite loading mode with infiniteConfig. The paginator becomes a button that loads more items on click. Use the onLoadMore output inside infiniteConfig to handle data loading logic.

api.title: API and reference
api.description: Complete documentation of Paginator component inputs, outputs and interfaces for advanced integration.

styling.title: Styling and customization
styling.description: Customize the paginator's appearance using CSS variables. Control layout, buttons, page numbers and more.

popover.title: Popover
popover.subtitle: Interactive floating content component with support for text, templates and dynamic components. Unlike Tooltip, popover can contain interactive elements like buttons, forms or lists.

basic.title: Basic usage
basic.description: Simple popover with text content. The popover is shown on click on the element (default behavior).

colors.title: Colors and variants
colors.description: Supports all NUI colors and variants (Solid, Outline, Ghost).
colors.note: Combine color and variant to customize the popover's appearance according to your needs.

positions.title: Positions
positions.description: Control the popover's preferred position: top, bottom, left or right. The popover automatically repositions if there's not enough space.

events.title: Trigger events
events.description: Define how the popover is activated: click (default), hover, focus or manual. Manual mode allows complete programmatic control.
events.note: When using nuiPopoverEvent we have three modes: 'click' (show/hide on click), 'hover' (show on mouse over and hide on leave) and 'focus' (show on focus and hide on blur).

template.title: Custom template
template.description: Use Angular templates for rich and interactive content. The template context provides a close function to close the popover.
template.note: The #popoverTemplate template receives a context with the close() function that you can use to close the popover from within the template.

component.title: Dynamic component
component.description: Render complete Angular components inside the popover. Ideal for forms, lists or complex content.

delays.title: Show / hide delays
delays.description: Configure delays in milliseconds before showing or hiding the popover. Useful for improving user experience in hover mode.

customization.title: Customization
customization.description: Customize the popover's appearance: no arrow, custom width, own CSS classes or greater separation offset.
customization.note: You can use nuiPopoverShowArrow to hide/show the arrow, nuiPopoverMaxWidth to define a maximum width, nuiPopoverMinWidth to define a minimum width, nuiPopoverClass to add custom CSS classes, and nuiPopoverOffset to adjust the distance between the popover and the target element.

closeOptions.title: Close options
closeOptions.description: Control how the popover can be closed: click outside, Escape key, or allow multiple popovers open simultaneously.
closeOptions.note: Use nuiPopoverCloseOnClickOutside to close on outside click, nuiPopoverCloseOnEscape to close with Escape, and nuiPopoverAllowMultiple to allow multiple popovers open at once.

backdrop.title: Backdrop
backdrop.description: Add a dark background behind the popover to create a modal experience. You can control whether clicking the backdrop closes the popover or not.
backdrop.note: Use nuiPopoverBackdrop to enable/disable the backdrop and nuiBackdropClose to control whether clicking the backdrop closes the popover.

disabled.title: Disabled state
disabled.description: Dynamically control whether the popover is enabled or disabled.
disabled.note: When nuiPopoverDisabled is true, the popover will not show or respond to events.

api.title: API and reference
api.description: Complete documentation of the nuiPopover directive, injection tokens and advanced usage.

styling.title: Styling and customization
styling.description: Customize the popover's appearance using CSS variables. Control colors, size, shadows and animations.

toast.title: Toast
toast.subtitle: Temporary non-intrusive notifications for user feedback

basic.title: Basic toasts
basic.description: Show simple notifications with different types: success, error, warning and info.

withTitle.title: Toasts with title
withTitle.description: Add a title to give more context to the notification.

withActions.title: Toasts with actions
withActions.description: Include action buttons so the user can interact with the notification.

positions.title: Positions
positions.description: Control where toasts appear on screen: top-left, top-center, top-right, bottom-left, bottom-center, bottom-right.

iconTop.title: Icon at the top
iconTop.description: Shows the toast icon centered at the top for a more prominent design.
iconTop.note: Use the iconPosition='top' property to center the icon at the top of the toast. This is especially useful for toasts with titles and actions, as it improves visual hierarchy and makes the icon more prominent.

icons.title: Custom icons
icons.description: You can show default icons according to toast type or use custom icons. You can even hide the icon if you wish.
icons.note: Use the icon property. If you use the value false the icon will be hidden. If you use string you can specify a custom Remix Icon icon. By default icons are shown according to toast type with icon value true.

duration.title: Duration
duration.description: Configure how long the toast remains visible before disappearing. Use 0 for toasts that don't auto-close.

loading.title: Loading toast
loading.description: Show a toast with loading state that can be dynamically updated when the operation completes.

api.title: API and reference
api.description: Complete documentation of ToastService, interfaces and advanced usage of the notification system.

styling.title: Styling and customization
styling.description: Customize the toasts' appearance using CSS variables. Control colors, size, animations and more.

sidebar-panel.title: Sidebar Panel
sidebar-panel.subtitle: Sliding side panels with CDK Overlay to show dynamic content

basic.title: Basic usage
basic.description: Open a side panel from the SidebarPanelService service. The panel slides from the edge of the screen with a smooth animation.

default.title: Default configuration
default.description: The panel will open using the global default values configured.
default.note: If no options are provided when opening the panel, the global default values defined in the NUI configuration of provideNUIConfig({ sidebarPanel: {...} }) will be used.

sizes.title: Sizes
sizes.description: Allows defining the size with which the panel will open.
sizes.note: You can use predefined values like 'xs', 'sm', 'md', 'lg', 'xl' and 'full'.

positions.title: Positions
positions.description: Control from which side of the screen the panel slides.
positions.note: Use the position property to define the side from which the panel will open using 'right', 'left', 'top' or 'bottom' as values.

dynamicComponent.title: Dynamic component
dynamicComponent.description: Load any Angular component inside the panel and pass data through dependency injection
dynamicComponent.note: Use the data property to pass data to the dynamically loaded component. This data is injected using the SIDEBAR_PANEL_DATA token. If we also want to reference the panel itself from the loaded component, we can inject SIDEBAR_PANEL_REF.

htmlContent.title: HTML content
htmlContent.description: You can open panels with HTML content without creating a component. Ideal for simple notifications, messages or dynamically generated content.
htmlContent.note: Use the htmlContent property to pass an HTML string. You can generate the HTML dynamically or concatenate it with your data. This option does not require creating a full Angular component.

templateContent.title: Template content
templateContent.description: Use Angular templates with context data and functions without needing a full component. Ideal for reusable content with dynamic data.
templateContent.note: Use the contentTemplate property to pass a TemplateRef and templateContext to pass data and functions. The template receives the context through let-varname variables. This allows for interactivity without creating a component.

events.title: @Output events from dynamic components
events.description: Listen to events emitted by the component loaded inside the panel to handle interactions and close the panel when necessary.
events.note: You can subscribe to outputs from the dynamically loaded component. Use panelRef.componentInstance to access the child component instance and subscribe to its @Output().

minimizable.title: Minimizable panel
minimizable.description: Panels can be minimized to a tab that will be located at the place from which the Sidebar opens to free up screen space while preserving the state, being able to restore it when desired.
minimizable.note:
Use the minimizable attribute to make the Sidebar minimizable. Additionally, you can use the minimize() method of the SidebarPanel to minimize the panel programmatically and restore() to restore it. If minimizable is enabled, the id attribute is required to identify the minimized panel. You can also check if the Sidebar is minimized using isMinimized.

Tab customization: You can customize the icon, add text, apply custom CSS or use a completely custom template through minimizedTabCustomization. For floating buttons with free positioning (e.g.: chat bottom-right), use standalone: true to render outside the grouped container and avoid positioning restrictions.

closeButton.title: Close button
closeButton.description: Control the visibility of the close button in the panel header.
closeButton.note: Use the showCloseButton property to show or hide the close button in the panel header.

backdrop.title: Backdrop
backdrop.description: Add a dark background behind the panel to create a modal experience. Control whether clicking the backdrop closes the panel or not.
backdrop.note: Use the hasBackdrop property to enable/disable the backdrop (default true) and closeOnBackdropClick to control whether clicking the backdrop closes the panel.

customBackdrop.title: Custom backdrop
customBackdrop.description: Customize the backdrop with custom CSS classes. You can apply effects like blur, custom colors and transitions.
customBackdrop.note: Use the backdropClass property to add custom CSS classes to the panel backdrop. You can add a single class or an array of classes.

multiple.title: Multiple panels
multiple.description: Open multiple panels simultaneously from different sides. Control stacking with z-index and close all at once.
multiple.note: Each open panel is independent and can have its own configuration. Use the closeAll() method of the SidebarPanelService service to programmatically close all open panels simultaneously.

api.title: API
api.description: Available interfaces and methods of the SidebarPanel component.

styling.title: Styling and Customization
styling.description: Customize the panel's appearance using CSS variables. You can override these variables in your custom theme.

tooltip.title: Tooltip
tooltip.subtitle: Informative tooltips with support for text and custom templates

basic.title: Basic tooltips
basic.description: Shows simple tooltips with text on hover.
basic.note: You can disable the arrow with tooltipShowArrow.

positions.title: Positions
positions.description: Control the tooltip position relative to the element: top (default), bottom, left, right.

events.title: Events
events.description: Define which event triggers the tooltip: hover (default), click, focus, or manual for programmatic control.

delays.title: Delays
delays.description: Configure delays before showing and hiding the tooltip.
delays.note: Use the tooltipShowDelay and tooltipHideDelay properties to adjust wait times.

templates.title: Custom templates
templates.description: Use Angular templates to show enriched HTML content in the tooltip.

interactive.title: Interactive tooltips
interactive.description: Allow interaction with tooltip content. Useful for including buttons or links.
interactive.note: Enable the tooltipInteractive property to allow interaction within the tooltip without it automatically closing when moving the cursor.

disabled.title: Disabled state
disabled.description: Dynamically control whether the tooltip is enabled or disabled.
disabled.note: Use the tooltipDisabled property to activate or deactivate the tooltip as needed.

api.title: API and reference
api.description: Complete documentation of the nuiTooltip directive with all its inputs, outputs and usage examples.

styling.title: Styling and customization
styling.description: Customize the tooltip's appearance using CSS variables. Control colors, size, animations and more.
